title: Deputies arrest alleged shooter in slaying of teen
content:
The alleged shooter in the slaying of a 16-year-old boy last month has been charged with first-degree murder, according to the Orange County Sheriff's Office.
Henry Brandon Floyd, 23, is the second man charged in the July 21 shooting death of David Grimmage in what deputies describe as a drug deal gone bad.
Floyd and Darrius William Miller met Grimmage and other men in the parking lot the Family Dollar near North Hiawassee and Clarcona Ocoee roads to make a drug transaction.
Deputies allege Floyd pointed a gun at the vehicle the boy was in and demanded money.
One of the men in the vehicle with Grimmage started firing in self-defense, deputies said.
They exchanged gunfire and Grimmage was struck in the head, deputies said.
He was pronounced dead on scene.
Three other people, including Miller, were also shot, deputies said. They all survived.
Miller orchestrated the robbery that led to Grimmage's death, according to deputies.
He also is charged with first-degree murder.
Floyd, who also was charged with attempted murder and armed robbery, is at the Orange County Jail without bond.
dharris@tribune.com or 407-420-5471
